drug.name: SGN-15
drug.description: SGN-15 is studied in the treatment of cancer. It combines a monoclonal antibody with the anticancer drug doxorubicin. Monoclonal antibodies are substances that are made in the laboratory and that can locate and bind to cancer cells. Doxorubicin is a type of anthracycline antitumor antibiotic. When it is combined with a monoclonal antibody, it forms a type of drug conjugate. Also called cBR96-doxorubicin immunoconjugate.

article.citation: Smith SV: SGN-10. Seattle Genetics. Curr Opin Investig Drugs. 2001 Sep;2(9):1314-9.

drug.indication: Investigated for use/treatment in breast cancer, colorectal cancer, and lung cancer.
drug.mechanism-of-action: SGN-15 is a first-generation product composed of the chimeric BR96 antibody chemically joined by an acid-labile hydrazone linker to the chemotherapeutic drug doxorubicin.
